revised_title: Seismic Wave Propagation in a Self-Gravitating Anisotropic Earth: A Mathematical Analysis
tldr: This article presents a mathematical theory of seismic wave propagation in a self-gravitating, anisotropic Earth. The authors discuss the propagation of acceleration waves in a spherical, elastic Earth with transverse isotropy and consider the effects of self-gravitation on the initial stress. They find that the classical Herglotz-Wiechert method for determining wave speed breaks down in this case, leading to erroneous results.
